string.value: TRAITOR|We got you, Druid! Now we'll see who has the power to make laws in this land. You will pay us for persecuting our brothers!
HIGH DRUID|So you deceived me... I don't blame you, because you don't know what you're doing. But no evil goes unpunished. It's the law of life.
TRAITOR|Don't listen to that silly old man! Go to Uluk, where you will receive your reward.
|See you there.
|Finally, we reached the island.
LISA|I know some people here, but I don't think they can help you.
|And who are they?
LISA|My old friends with a turbulent past. That's where I'm going.
LISA|Go ahead alone. When you need me, look for me at their place.
REBEL|Come on, hurry up! We can still save ourselves!
REFUGEES|Save us, good man! We have refused to accept the vile faith of the machine-worshippers. Now we are pursued everywhere by furious heretics!
|Don't be afraid, brothers! Together we will repel the attack! Those who can hold weapons in their hands, let them fight!
REFUGEES|No more retreating! It's time to take the fight! Hooray!
|We repulsed the attack, but the heretics may return. Let's go to Set! No one can touch us beyond its walls!
REFUGEES|Thank you for your help, good man! You have given us hope for tomorrow.
|I could not protect them...
|What kind of strange machines are these? Now I understand what the druids were afraid of. It gives me goosebumps to see such an awful thing.
|This is not the first time I've fought monsters. Our cause is just, we will win!
|The sanctuary violators have been killed. I can go back to the druids now.
|The Runestone is planted, and I must escape before the wrath of Mother Earth comes down on me and the monsters' lair.
|Barely made it. That's the power of nature.
|I must return to Set and justify myself in the eyes of the High Druid.
Do you wish to travel to another region?
|I don't know where this road leads, so I'll stay here.
|It's a strange place. I'd better stay away from here.
